newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Hanbo, Sang-A shares halted.
newsitem.headline: Hanbo, Sang-A shares halted.

text.p: The shares of South Korea's Hanbo Steel Corp and its affiliate Sang-A Pharmaceutical Co will be halted for trading indefinitely from Friday, the Korea Stock Exchange said.
Hanbo Steel defaulted on loan payments on Thursday and the company's main creditor banks have agreed to file for court receivership for the nation's leading steel maker.

There was no immediate news whether Sang-A has defaulted any debt payment, but trading of its shares was suspended because it is expected to be affected by Hanbo's failure, an exchange spokesman said.
Hanbo shares last traded at 5,390 won per share and Sang-A at 11,500 won.
